post.description:
Upload 1 or more files to RikAI2-Extract for asynchronous processing. To receive the model output, use either a `webhook` or an `outputURL`:
- **`webhook` (Recommended)**: Receives a [JSON response](/../../models/rikai/webhook-examples) by default.
- `outputURL`: Receives a [ZIP file](../../outputurl) for each document in the request. If the `returnJSON` parameter is set to true, a JSON file will be provided instead.


#### File upload options
We only support requests with Content-Type `application/json` at this endpoint.
- `[application/json]` **inputURL**  link to file
- `[application/json]` **base64** base64 encoded file data

parameters.name: apiVersion

schema.title: apiVersion
schema.description: API version used for the request. Defaults to the latest production version. To pin to a specific API version, please contact your Lazarus representative to receive the appropriate version header.

parameters.description: API version used for the request. Defaults to the latest production version. To pin to a specific API version, please contact your Lazarus representative to receive the appropriate version header.

get.description: Retrieves the status of an asynchronous request to `/rikai/zip/rikai2-extract?async=True` or `/rikai/bulk/rikai2-extract`. Identifiable by `statusId`.

parameters.name: apiVersion

schema.title: apiVersion
schema.description: API version used for the request. Defaults to the latest production version. To pin to a specific API version, please contact your Lazarus representative to receive the appropriate version header.

parameters.description: API version used for the request. Defaults to the latest production version. To pin to a specific API version, please contact your Lazarus representative to receive the appropriate version header.

answer.description: Model's answer to the question asked. The model fills the JSON structure that was provided for input.

model.description: Model used by the request identified by the status ID.

status.description: Status of the model request identified by the status ID.

code.description: HTTP code of the model request identified by the status ID.

documentId.description: Document ID of the model request identified by the status ID. Document ID is the value of fileId if it is supplied in the model request; otherwise, a random UUID is generated.

message.description: Error message for the model request identified by the status ID, if that request failed.

error.description: Additional error details about the failure of the model request identified by status ID, if available.

apiVersion.description: API version passed into the header of this status request. Defaults to the latest production version. To pin to a specific API version, please contact your Lazarus representative to receive the appropriate version header.

id.description: Response ID for this status request. This is not an identifier of the model request being checked by the status ID.

startTime.description: Start time for this status request, recorded in epoch (Unix timestamp, ms) format. This is not the start time of the model request being checked by status ID.

endTime.description: End time for this status request, recorded in epoch (Unix timestamp, ms) format. This is not the end time of the model request being checked by status ID.

base64.description: Base64 encoded string for the file from which data will be extracted. If the value is an array of base64 strings, you receive an individual response for each string.

question.description: A JSON string or a dictionary containing the question(s) to be asked.

webhook.description:
Webhook URL to which status updates and JSON response will be sent. This is where you will receive the model output. 
[Click here](/../../models/rikai/webhook-examples) for an example of a webhook URL response.

webhookHeaders.description: Request headers to include in the POST requests to the webhook.

webhookSendFull.description: Receive the full JSON response at the webhook URL upon request completion. Set to `false` to only receive request status.

fileId.description: Custom ID for uploaded file, returned as `documentId` in the response. Requests with multiple files accept unique fileIds for each file. FileIds can be used to facilitate tracking, referencing, and managing input and output files efficiently.

forceOCR.description: Will rasterize a pdf. Set this parameter to `true` only if the input file is a fillable pdf.

language.description: A language code (e.g. 'EN') or the name of the language you wish to translate answers and explainability into. [List of supported codes.](../../../prompting-guide/faq/#supported-languages)

metadata.description: Custom JSON to be included in the returned response.

outputURL.description: URL where resulting [ZIP file](../../outputurl) or JSON can be sent. Must be open to PUT requests.

outputURLHeaders.description: Request headers to include in the PUT request to the output URL.

returnJSON.description: Specifies the format of the response sent to `outputURL`. When set to true, a JSON response is sent to the `outputURL`. Set to false to send a ZIP file instead.

sftp.description: SFTP authentication details. Required for SFTP URLs in `inputURL` or `outputURL`. Option to provide separate server authentication info for `inputURL` and `outputURL`.

staticIP.description: Set to `true` for static IP for webhook and outputURL if they exist

model.description: Model used to process the document.

statusId.description: A list of document IDs, each representing an uploaded file. Each ID is a randomly generated UUID. These IDs serve as input for retrieving the status of an asynchronous request via the `/rikai/zip/async/{statusId}` endpoint.

apiVersion.description: API version used for the request. Defaults to the latest production version. To pin to a specific API version, please contact your Lazarus representative to receive the appropriate version header.

endTime.description: Request end time recorded in epoch (Unix timestamp) format.

failedRequests.description: File requests that failed to queue.

startTime.description: Request start time recorded in epoch (Unix timestamp) format.

inputURL.description: URL for the file to extract data from: Must be a PDF, JPEG, JPG, PNG, HEIC, SVG, TIFF, TIF, TXT, or GIF.

question.description: A JSON string or a dictionary containing the question(s) to be asked.

webhook.description:

[Click here](/../../models/rikai/webhook-examples) for an example of a webhook URL response.

400.description: Bad request or failure to read. Request was invalid or we could not process your data.

value.message: Request body is missing required field(s): question

403.description: Unauthorized attempt. There was an issue with your credentials, model permissions or billing.

404.description: Not found error. When a request references an invalid endpoint or resource.

413.description: Payload too large. The request payload or file size > 32MB and organization doesn't have 'big file' permission.

value.message: [File was too large](../../../prompting-guide/faq/#what-if-i-encounter-an-error-indicating-my-file-is-too-large). Model could not process request.

429.description: Too many requests, rate limit exceeded

value.message: You have exceeded the rate limit. Please retry your request later.
An internal error occurred. Please retry your request and report this to support@lazarusai.com.

522.description: Model failed. This status code is sent to your webhook.

value.message: A RikAI2 error occurred. Please report this to support@lazarusai.com.
